topic.title: HPE Helion OpenStack 1.1: Working With StoreVirtual Backends

body.p: Once you register the StoreVirtual clusters as per your requirements, you can use the overcloud option in the Horizon undercloud dashboard for the following tasks:

li.p: Add backend (required)
Expand backend (optional)
Shrink backend (optional)
Delete backend (optional)
Generate configuration (required)
Update Overcloud (required)

section.title: Add backend
section.p: This option allows you to add a backend. Adding a StoreVirtual cluster as a backend, moves the cluster to the 'reserved' state. This means that the cluster cannot be removed from the cloud inventory when Cinder is configured to use this cluster as storage backend.
To add a backend, do the following:

li.p: In the Configure Cloud page, click the StoreVitual Backends Tab.
Configure Cloud Page
Click Add Backend at the top to open the StoreVirtual Volume Backend page.
StoreVirtual Volume Backend Page
In the Volume Backend Name box, enter the name for the backend.
From the Available StoreVirtual Cluster Choices box, select the cluster(s).
Click → to move the cluster to the Selected StoreVirtual Cluster Choices box.
(Optional) Click Choose All displayed below the Available StoreVirtual Cluster Choices box to select all the clusters .
(Optional) Click Remove All displayed below the Selected StoreVirtual Cluster Choices box or select the cluster(s) and click ←to move the cluster(s) back to Available StoreVirtual Choices box.
Click Add.On successful addition of backend, the backend displays in the Backend Mapping table in the Configure Cloud page.
Backend Displays in the Configure Cloud Page

section.title: Expand backend
section.p: Expand option allocates additional clusters to an existing backend. You can select the required clusters from the list of registered clusters and add them to a backend that has already been configured.
To expand a backend, do the following:

li.p: In the Configure Cloud page, click StoreVirtual Backends Tab to activate it. The page displays a list of backends.
Expand Backend Option
Click Expand Backend against the backend that you want to expand. Expand StoreVirtual Volume Backend page is displayed.
Expand Backend Page with Update Option
From the Available StoreVirtual Cluster Choices box, select the Cluster.
Click → to move the cluster(s)to the Selected StoreVirtual Cluster Choices box.
(Optional) Click Choose All displayed below the Available StoreVirtual Cluster Choices box to select and move all the clusters to the Selected StoreVirtual Cluster Choices box.

(Optional) Click Remove All displayed below the Selected StoreVirtual Cluster Choices box or select the cluster(s) and click ←to move the clusters back to Available StoreVirtual Cluster Choices box. .
Click Update.On successful update, the number of clusters mapped to the backend is updated and displays in the Backend Mapping table in the Configure Cloud page.

section.title: Shrink backend
section.p: Shrinking removes the clusters from the backend which are allocated to your cloud. Shrinking the only available StoreVirtual cluster in the backend will delete the backend. To shrink the backend, do the following:

li.p: In the Configure Cloud page, click StoreVirtual Backends Tab to activate it. The page displays a list of backends.
Click More drop-down list against the Volume Backend for which you want to reduce the cluster(s) and select Shrink Backend. Configure StoreVirtual Backend page is displayed.
Shrink Backend Option
From the Existing StoreVirtual Clusters box, select the cluster(s).
Click → to move the cluster(s)to the Removed StoreVirtual Clusters box.
(Optional) Click Remove All displayed below the Existing StoreVirtual Cluster(s) box to move all the cluster(s) to Removed StoreVirtual Clusters box.
(Optional) Click Select All displayed below the Removed StoreVirtual Clusters box or select the cluster(s) and click ←to move the cluster(s) back to Existing StoreVirtual Clusters box.
Click Update.On successful update, the number of clusters mapped to the backend is updated and displays in the Backend Mapping table in the Configure Cloud page.
Shrink Backend Page with Update Option

section.title: Delete backend
section.p: This option removes the backend from the cloud.
section.note: Before you delete a backend, detach the volumes from the VM instance, as this backend will not be available once it is deleted.

li.p: In the Configure Cloud page, click StoreVirtual Backends Tab to activate it. The page displays a list of backends.
Click More drop-down list against the Volume Backend which you want to delete and select Delete volume backend. A confirmation dialog box is displayed.
Click Delete volume backend to delete or Cancel to cancel the process.

section.title: Generate configuration
section.p: Download the Cinder configuration for your cloud once you have created the backend.
To generate a configuration file, do the following:

li.p: In the Configure Cloud page, click StoreVirtual Backends Tab to activate it. The page displays a list of backends.
Generate Configuration Option
Click Generate Config displayed at the top of the page to display Download StoreVirtual Config page. The configuration file downloads automatically.
(Optional) Click Download StoreVirtual Config link to download the file if the file does not automatically download . A dialog box is displayed.
Click OK to download and save the file.Once you download the configuration file, you can proceed to update the overcloud configuration.
